page.title: 01BEDLINGTON - PAST & PRESENT
page.content: Bedlington itself dates back to Anglo-Saxon times (Bedlas ton -the settlement of Bedlas a chieftain.)Today the close links with that period are to be seen in St Cuthbert's Church. Much of Bedlington's attractive Front Street is over l00 years & centred upon the Market place. The area is essentially rural in character with farming predominant. The River Blyth bissects the block and the Blyth Valley is interesting ecologically as well as providing a very attractive leisure area. Mining connections are still strong - Hartford Hall rehabilitation centre; the Bedlington Miner's Picnic - but little visible evidence remains of the areas premier industry. Family Life is traditional, close knit and has helped to weather the storm of unemployment.
